record.description: [In autumn of 1919, the British Educational Mission to the United States came to the University of Chicago for the purposes finding the best means of creating a closer cooperation between British and American educational institutions. The members of the British delegation were as follows: Dr. Arthur Everett Shipley, vice chancellor of Cambridge; Sir Henry Miers, vice chancellor of the University of Manchester; Reverend Edward Mewburn Walker, librarian of Queen’s College, Oxford University; Sir Dr. John Joly, Trinity College, Dublin; Caroline Spurgeon, Bedford College, University of London, and Rose Sidgwick, University of Birmingham. The American representatives at this meeting included the Honorable Elihu Root, chairman; President Donald J. Cowling, Carleton College; James Rowland Angell, Vice-President, University of Chicago; Ernest D. Burton, R.G. Mouton, T.C. Chamberlin, W.G. Hale, and Marion Talbot, all of the University of Chicago. Shown around the table, shown starting at the right: Sir Henry Miers, J.R. Angell, A.E. Shipley (standing), Sir Henry Jones, Shailer Matthews, Reverend E.M. Walker, Paul Shorey, Rose Sidgwick, E.D. Burton, W.A. Payne, A.W. Small, R.R. Bensley, C.H. Judd, J.H. Breasted, Caroline Spurgeon, R.D. Salisbury, and John J. Joly (seated at the corner of the table.)]
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: See University Record, Jan 1919, pp.1-2. Mounted on board.
